title: Provider Router - Go LiteLLM Implementation
description: Core provider-agnostic routing layer. Reimplements LiteLLM concepts in Go: unified OpenAI-compatible interface, provider adapters, load balancing, fallbacks, cost tracking. This is the foundation that decouples agent orchestration from any specific LLM provider.

title: Implement Google Gemini provider adapter
description: Adapter for Google Gemini/Vertex AI. Handle auth (API key or service account), streaming, tool use translation.

title: Build router with model-to-provider mapping
description: Router that reads config and routes model requests to correct provider adapter. Support model aliases (e.g., 'supervisor' -> 'anthropic/claude-sonnet-4-20250514').

title: Add fallback chain support to router
description: When primary model/provider fails, automatically try fallback models. Configurable fallback chains per role. Error classification (rate limit, context window, auth, timeout).

title: Add load balancing to router
description: Distribute requests across multiple deployments of same model. Strategies: round-robin, least-busy, latency-based. Health checking with cooldown.

title: Add cost tracking to router
description: Track token usage and estimated cost per request, per model, per role. Price tables for known models. Budget limits per role/session.

title: Analyze gastown source for Claude Code coupling points
description: Map every file/function in gastown that references Claude Code, Anthropic, or hardcoded provider assumptions. Produce a coupling report for surgical replacement.

title: Abstract agent session layer from Claude Code
description: Gastown's session layer manages Claude Code instances via settings.json hooks. Replace with generic agent session that launches any LLM-backed agent via the provider router.

title: Implement generic agent launcher (replace Claude Code spawning)
description: Replace gastown's Claude Code tmux session spawning with a generic agent launcher that starts an LLM session via the provider router. Support both interactive and non-interactive modes.

title: Adapt polecat lifecycle for multi-provider
description: Ensure polecat identity/session/sandbox layers work with any provider. Model assignment per polecat configurable. Idle/working/stalled states provider-agnostic.

title: Adapt Mayor role for configurable supervisor model
description: Mayor currently assumes Claude. Make supervisor model configurable — any frontier model can be Mayor. Preserve convoy creation and work decomposition patterns.

title: Agent Orchestrator - Gastown Fork Adaptation
description: Fork and adapt gastown's multi-agent orchestration (Mayor, Polecats, Crew, Witness, Refinery) to use the Provider Router instead of Claude Code. Replace hooks-based Claude Code integration with generic provider interface. Preserve gastown's work decomposition patterns (convoys, beads, worktrees).

title: Adapt Witness and Refinery for generic agents
description: Ensure monitoring (Witness) and merge queue (Refinery) roles work with provider-agnostic agent sessions.

title: Design YAML config schema for model routing
description: Config format mapping: roles -> models -> providers. Support aliases, fallbacks, per-role overrides. Example: mayor: {model: claude-sonnet-4-20250514, provider: anthropic}, polecat: {model: qwen3-coder:32b, provider: ollama-local}.

title: Implement config parser and validator
description: Go config parser for the YAML schema. Validate model/provider combinations. Error on invalid configs before launching agents.

title: Build et CLI entry point (adapt gt)
description: Rename/adapt gastown's gt CLI to et (electrictown). Preserve core commands: sling, done, prime, mail. Add provider-specific commands: et models, et providers, et route.

title: Replace go-openai with native OpenAI HTTP client
description: Remove sashabaranov/go-openai dependency. Implement native HTTP client for OpenAI API with SSE streaming. Only external dep should be net/http.

title: Replace ollama/api with native Ollama HTTP client
description: Remove ollama/api dependency. Implement native HTTP client for Ollama REST API. Same API works for local and cloud.

title: Replace anthropic-sdk-go with native Anthropic HTTP client
description: Remove any Anthropic SDK dependency. Implement native HTTP client for Messages API with SSE streaming.

title: Audit and replace remaining 3rd party dependencies
description: Review all go.mod dependencies. For each non-stdlib dependency, assess: keep (provider SDK), replace (implement native), or remove (unused). Track each replacement.

title: PoC: Single supervisor + single worker round-trip
description: Minimum demo: Claude (supervisor) receives a coding task, decomposes it, sends subtask to local Ollama (worker), collects result. Proves the routing layer works end-to-end.

title: PoC: Multi-worker parallel execution
description: Extend PoC: supervisor decomposes task into N subtasks, routes to N Ollama workers in parallel, collects and merges results.

title: Configuration and CLI System
description: YAML-driven configuration for model-to-provider mapping per agent role. Adapt gastown's gt CLI for electrictown (et CLI). Support role-based model assignment (e.g., Mayor uses Claude, Polecats use local Ollama).

title: PoC: Mixed cloud+local worker routing
description: Demo routing some subtasks to Ollama cloud models and others to local Ollama, based on task complexity or config rules.

title: Cross-Platform Build System
description: Build system supporting cross-compilation for AMD64, ARM64, RISCV64, PPC, PPC64. Default to host architecture, with build-all option producing distributable artifacts (subdirectory or tarball per arch). Implementation approach (Makefile, shell script, etc.) determined by architect.

title: Architect cross-compilation build approach
description: Evaluate Makefile vs shell script vs Go-based build tool (mage, task, etc.) for cross-compilation. Must support: GOOS=linux with GOARCH=amd64,arm64,riscv64,ppc64,ppc64le. Consider: CGO_ENABLED=0 for static binaries, version injection via -ldflags, output naming convention (et-linux-amd64, etc.), build-all target with dist/ directory or per-arch tarballs. Recommend approach and document rationale.

title: Implement build script with single-arch default
description: Create the build script (per ET-32 decision). Must: detect host GOARCH as default, accept arch argument to override, build all binaries in cmd/ (et, et-poc, et-poc-parallel, et-poc-mixed), inject version via ldflags from git describe or git rev-parse --short HEAD, output to build/ or dist/ directory with arch-specific naming.

title: Add build-all target for all architectures
description: Add build-all option that cross-compiles for all 5 targets: linux/amd64, linux/arm64, linux/riscv64, linux/ppc64, linux/ppc64le. Output to dist/{os}-{arch}/ subdirectories with binaries, or create tarballs (dist/electrictown-linux-amd64.tar.gz etc.) suitable for copying to target hosts. Include a manifest or checksums file (sha256sums.txt).

title: Test cross-compilation for all target architectures
description: Verify that go build succeeds for all 5 GOARCH targets (amd64, arm64, riscv64, ppc64, ppc64le) with CGO_ENABLED=0. Verify file type with 'file' command on each binary. Verify version string injection. This is a compilation check, not a runtime test (we may not have hardware for all arches).

title: Project Documentation and GitHub Presence
description: Fill out GitHub repository description and create comprehensive README.md. Credit original inspirations (gastown by Steve Yegge, LiteLLM) while explaining how electrictown has diverged into its own implementation. Include architecture overview, quickstart, configuration reference, and build instructions.

title: Write GitHub repository description
description: Set the short GitHub repo description (About section). Should concisely convey: provider-agnostic multi-agent coding orchestrator in Go, routes any LLM provider (Ollama, OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini) through a unified router with role-based model assignment, fallback chains, and cost tracking. Keep under 350 chars (GitHub limit). Also set relevant topics/tags.

title: Write comprehensive README.md
description: Create README.md with sections: (1) Project overview — what electrictown is and why it exists, (2) Credits/Acknowledgments — credit steveyegge/gastown as the original inspiration for multi-agent coding orchestration and BerriAI/litellm as inspiration for the provider routing concept, noting that electrictown is a clean-room Go implementation, (3) Architecture — provider router, role system, session layer, cost tracking, (4) Supported providers — Ollama (local+cloud), OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, (5) Configuration — YAML schema reference with examples, (6) Build instructions — reference the build system from ET-31, (7) Usage — et run, et models, et version, (8) Role system — mayor, polecat, witness, refinery with descriptions, (9) License.

title: Ollama Authentication Support
description: Add comprehensive optional authentication support for Ollama instances. Local Ollama requires no auth (default). Ollama Cloud uses Bearer token (Authorization: Bearer API_KEY). Self-hosted network Ollama behind reverse proxies may use Bearer tokens or HTTP Basic Auth. Our adapter already sends Bearer when api_key is set, but needs config ergonomics, Basic Auth support for proxied instances, and documentation.

title: Dependency Replacement - Self-Contained Goal
description: Track and plan replacement of all 3rd party libraries with native Go implementations. PoC uses external libs (go-openai, ollama/api, etc.) but medium-term goal is self-contained with only provider SDKs as external deps. Each task represents one library to internalize.

title: Add auth_type field to ProviderConfig for Ollama
description: Add an optional auth_type field to ProviderConfig (YAML: auth_type) supporting: 'bearer' (default when api_key set), 'basic' (HTTP Basic Auth for reverse-proxied Ollama), 'none' (explicit no-auth, default when no api_key). For 'basic' auth, api_key field holds 'username:password' which gets base64-encoded into 'Authorization: Basic ...' header. This is provider-agnostic in the config but initially used by the Ollama adapter for proxied instances. Other providers always use their native auth.

title: Update Ollama adapter to support Bearer and Basic auth
description: Update internal/provider/ollama/ollama.go setHeaders() to read auth_type from config. Currently hardcodes Bearer. Should support: (1) no api_key → no auth header (local default), (2) api_key with auth_type=bearer or unset → Authorization: Bearer (Ollama Cloud, Bearer-proxy), (3) api_key='user:pass' with auth_type=basic → Authorization: Basic base64(user:pass) (nginx/Caddy proxied Ollama). The New() constructor needs to accept the auth_type, either as a new parameter or via an Option. Add tests for all three auth paths.

title: Update Ollama factory to pass auth_type from config
description: Update the Ollama provider factory in cmd/et/main.go buildFactories() to pass pc.AuthType (or equivalent) to the Ollama constructor. Currently only passes baseURL and apiKey. Ensure the factory correctly wires auth_type from YAML config through ProviderConfig to the Ollama adapter.

title: Add config validation for auth_type values
description: Validate auth_type in Config.Validate(): must be empty (default), 'bearer', 'basic', or 'none'. If auth_type=basic and api_key doesn't contain ':', warn or error. If auth_type=bearer or basic but api_key is empty, error. If auth_type=none but api_key is set, warn (auth_type=none with a key is suspicious). Add tests for all validation cases.

title: Document Ollama auth configuration in README
description: Add an 'Authentication' subsection to the Ollama section of README.md covering: (1) Local Ollama — no auth needed (default), (2) Ollama Cloud — set api_key to your Ollama API key, uses Bearer automatically, (3) Proxied Ollama with Bearer — same as cloud, set api_key, (4) Proxied Ollama with Basic Auth — set auth_type: basic and api_key: 'user:pass'. Include YAML config examples for each scenario. Reference Ollama's official docs at docs.ollama.com/api/authentication.

title: Document Caddy reverse proxy setup for Ollama
description: Create docs/caddy-reverse-proxy.md covering Caddy as a reverse proxy in front of Ollama for network deployments. Include: (1) Why — secure Ollama for network/multi-host access with TLS and auth, (2) Caddy install, (3) Basic Caddyfile config proxying to localhost:11434 with automatic HTTPS via Let's Encrypt, (4) Adding Basic Auth (caddy hash-password), (5) Adding Bearer token auth via header matching, (6) Example electrictown.yaml configs for each auth scenario, (7) TLS section strongly encouraging HTTPS with links to Let's Encrypt docs (https://letsencrypt.org/docs/) and Caddy's automatic HTTPS docs (https://caddyserver.com/docs/automatic-https), (8) Troubleshooting common issues. Link from README.md's Ollama auth section. Separate .md file, not inline in README.

title: Byobu/tmux session management
description: Add byobu/tmux session management to electrictown CLI. Spawn persistent agent sessions in tmux panes, watch them work in real-time, and manage via CLI subcommands.

title: tmux.Runner interface and TmuxRunner
description: Runner interface wrapping 6 tmux commands + TmuxRunner with injectable runCmd

title: Byobu auto-detection and ByobuRunner
description: ByobuRunner + DetectByobu + NewAutoRunner factory

title: Executor interface and SubprocessExecutor extraction
description: Executor interface + extract existing Execute/Stop into SubprocessExecutor

title: End-to-End PoC - Supervisor + Worker Demo
description: Proof of concept: frontier model (e.g., Claude/GPT-4) supervises a coding task, decomposes it, routes subtasks to local Ollama workers. Demonstrates the full loop: task assignment, model routing, work execution, result collection. Minimum viable demonstration of the electrictown concept.

title: TmuxExecutor implementation
description: TmuxExecutor: creates tmux sessions with et-role-shorthex naming, readiness polling

title: CLI session subcommands
description: et session spawn/list/attach/kill/send subcommands

title: TmuxRunner unit tests
description: Unit tests with mock runCmd injection for all 6 Runner methods

title: ByobuRunner unit tests
description: Detection tests via env var manipulation and delegation verification

title: TmuxExecutor unit tests
description: Tests with mock Runner: session creation, naming, collisions, readiness

title: CLI session subcommand tests
description: Tests for spawn/list/attach/kill/send subcommands

title: Verify et run pipeline unchanged
description: make test passes, et run works exactly as before refactoring

title: Update README and AGENTS.md
description: Document et session subcommands in README and AGENTS.md

title: Parallel multi-host worker pool
description: Fan subtasks across fleet in parallel using WorkerPool + Balancer

title: Pool config field and validation
description: Add Pool []string to RoleConfig, PoolForRole accessor, validate pool aliases

title: Define provider interface (Router contract)
description: Design the core Go interface that all provider adapters must implement: ChatCompletion, StreamChatCompletion, ListModels, Embeddings. OpenAI-compatible request/response types.

title: WorkerPool dispatcher with Balancer
description: internal/pool/ package with ExecuteAll using bounded concurrency

title: et run parallel pipeline with synthesis
description: Three-phase cmdRun: decompose, parallel execute, synthesize with --no-synthesize and --max-subtasks flags

title: Pool config validation tests
description: TestPoolForRole and TestValidation_PoolUnknownAlias

title: WorkerPool unit tests
description: Tests for ExecuteAll: basic, ordering, partial failure, bounded concurrency

title: Verify single-worker et run unchanged
description: Confirm legacy single-worker flow works when pool is not configured

title: Update README and AGENTS.md
description: Document pool config and parallel execution

title: Phase 1/3 spinner progress indicators
description: Add spinner to Phase 1 (supervisor decompose) and Phase 3 (supervisor synthesize) while waiting for LLM responses. Use terminal cursor control or a lightweight library.

title: Live per-worker progress lines in Phase 2
description: Update worker status lines in-place during parallel execution. Show worker name, status (running/done/error), tokens, tok/s. Use cursor-up escape codes to overwrite lines. Each worker needs its own start timestamp in pool.Result.

title: Per-worker tokens/sec tracking
description: Add per-worker elapsed time to pool.Result struct. Calculate tok/s = tokens / elapsed.Seconds() per worker. Display in Phase 2 summary table alongside tokens.

title: et nodes subcommand
description: New subcommand that pings each Ollama provider in config, lists reachable nodes with model names and a quick token rate benchmark. Shows offline nodes clearly. Pattern: et nodes [--config path]

title: Implement OpenAI provider adapter
description: Adapter for OpenAI API (GPT-4, GPT-4o, o1, etc.). Handles auth, streaming SSE, error mapping. PoC: use go-openai library.

title: Implement Anthropic provider adapter
description: Adapter for Anthropic Messages API (Claude models). Handle messages format translation to/from unified interface. PoC: use anthropic-sdk-go or HTTP client.

title: Implement Ollama provider adapter (local + cloud)
description: Single adapter for both local Ollama and Ollama cloud (same API, different host+auth). Handle model listing, chat completion, streaming. PoC: use ollama/api Go client.
